commit.message:
Remove extra list wrapping

There's no reason why this wrapping is required.

Clarify internal comment (2)

Picking up the leftovers from JDK-8008768. That comment does not have any sense for class declarations. So let's make the comment more general.

Clarify internal comment

1. It looks like JDK-8008768 mass-renamed "method" to "element". In that particular comment, "method" was used as an example, and it was wrong to change it to "element". Reverting that.
2. Also using of "element" instead of "Doc", which disappeared in JDK-8215584.
3. AFAIK, there were never subclasses of Doc.Output. Maybe the comment (introduced in JDK-4947455) meant "static nested" class? BTW, the idea of subclassing Output and Input as needed by taglets is nice.

Remove an outdated note

Firstly, ClassDoc was removed in JDK-8215584. Secondly, that note was ultimately about why we needed Utils.getAllInterfaces(TypeElement) when we had j.l.m.util.Types.directSupertypes(TypeMirror) and j.l.m.element.TypeElement.getInterfaces(). A maintainer can easily understand that without any comment: the one in Utils is a transitive closure, while the other two is a set of direct superinterfaces.

Clean up what was overlooked in JDK-8284299

That warning does not accept parameters; the `String message` is effectively ununsed.

Assert warning context

Also reformats code.

Update doc comment for InheritDocTaglet

While it may have gone unnoticed, since JDK-8008768 `@inheritDoc` can be used on a class (but not interface) doc comment: note Location.TYPE on L58.

Reformat some taglets

Those are mostly implementations of InheritableTaglet.

Reorganize null checks for Input.element

The null check explicitly performed in Input.copy is now performed there implicitly by the constructor.

Remove null checks for DocFinder.Output.inlineTags

Manual analysis suggests that DocFinder.Output.inlineTags cannot be null. The field is written to in 6 places, with the value obtained from these 6 methods:

    1. Utils.getFirstSentenceTrees(DocTree)
    2. Utils.getFullBody(DocTree)
    3. CommentHelper.getDescription(DocTree)
    4. CommentHelper.getReference(DocTree)
    5. CommentHelper.getTags(DocTree)
    6. CommentHelper.getBody(DocTree)

None of these methods currently returns null from relevant call sites. Moreover, that field is never observed to be null during a test run.

Clean up DocFinder.Input

Mainly reformats method parameters and rearranges methods.
